entries.Organization: Insitute for Innovations in Medical Education
Description: Worked at NYU with the Division of Learning Analytics to develop an online tool for ECG interpretation self-education and mastery.
Analyzed and visualized data from a study on the dynamics of online ECG learning.
Authoring a manuscript regarding this study for publication.

entries.PositionTitle: Medical Data Analysis Intern and Medical Scribe
Description: Served as a medical scribe at a clinic which serves Houston's diverse community, as well as those who cannot typically afford healthcare.
Performed analysis on the clinic's EMR data, results to be presented at the AAPI Health Summit 2015.
Work was sponsored by the Susan McAshan Summer Service Internship grant.
In High School, co-founded a successful web development company.
I have applied my skills in many different fields: from research and data visualization, to personal projects and business.
Worked for clients in Texas, across the Northeast, and as far as India. They include an online ticket vendor, awning distributor, NYC fashion boutique, and artisanal bakery
Responsible for regularly maintaining and updating content.
Redesigned several pages.
Developed Virtual Clinic and Learning Modules.
Developed medical reading list technology.

Description: Completely redesigned the Wiess College Website.
Developed and maintained the college's website and online resources.
Built an application to handle merchandise sale Venmo transactions.
Chosen for leadership because of strong involvement with college associates.
Coordinated the activities of a committee of other students responsible for organizing events.
Worked alongside associates to coordinate college events and activities to help unify the community.
Organized the biannual Associates Night banquet dinner
Worked alongside a court of seven other justices to adjudicate, resolve inter-student disputes, infractions and other Wiess cases.
Worked with the court to improve the safety of the on-campus drinking culture.
Elected by the Wiess student body.

entries.PositionTitle: Director of Research/Patient Discharge Planner/Shift Leader
Description: Lead a team of two discharge volunteers on shifts, coordinating discharge activities, maintaining records, and discharging patients.
Developed the initiative's quality improvement program from the ground up.
Volunteered with educators at the IDEA charter school working for an underserved, minority population living in the Rio Grande Valley.
Engaged in extensive service learning regarding the improvement of the American education system.
Chosen through competitive application process.
Discharged patients from the ER, and discussed follow-up appointments, medications and available social services.
Followed up with patients following discharge to answer questions, promote medication adherence, and encourage follow-up appointment attendance
CPR & Basic Life Support Certified.
Certified First Responder.
NYS EMT Number: 402797
Chosen through competitive application process.
Worked with a number of different service organizations around Houston
Engaged in service learning about socioeconomic disparities in Houston.
Led classes for younger and older students.
Taught martial arts technique and organized workouts.
Member of the Delta Leadership Team
Earned Black Belt in May, 2010
